p: In Justice's Court Seattle Precinct King County W.T. Before W. Soderberg Justice of the Peace
Territory of Washington Plaintiff vs. Thomas Gilbert Defendant } Commitment
To any constable in said county or the Keeper of the County Jail of said county Greeting

Whereas at a Justice Court held this day at the office of the undersigned in the City of Seattle in said county before the undersigned a Justice of the Peace of said County for the trial of for the offense hereinafter stated the said was convicted of having on the 1st day of May 1888 in said county committed the crim of disposing of beer to an Indian and upon conviction the said court did adjudge and determine that she said Thomas Gilber
should pay a fine of $100 and $- costs and should be imprisoned in the County Jail of King County W.T. for the period of 50 days or until the said fine and costs be paid and Whereas the said Thomas Gilbert has made default in the payment of said fine and costs. Therefore, you the said H.G. Thornton are hereby commanded forthwith to convey and deliver the said Thomas Gilbert to said Keeper and you the said Keeper are hereby commanded to receive the said Thomas Gilbert into your custody in said Jail and him there keep for the space of 50 days unless he shall sooner be thence discharged by due course of law
Dated at Seattle W.T. this 3 day of May 1888
Justice of the Peace Seattle Precinct King County W.T.
